en: And he said also unto the disciples, There was a certain rich man, who had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he was wasting his goods.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a inchûktirhai kuomah hi thu khawm hi a hril a; “Mi hausa tuin amanih sum enkawltu a nei a; chu pa chun a sum a sukthâmpêk mei mei chungah a kuomah an hêk a.

en: And he called him, and said unto him, What is this that I hear of thee? render the account of thy stewardship; for thou canst be no longer steward.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu a ko a, a kuomah, ‘I chungchâng thu ka hriet hi iengtizie am a na? I sum enkawl chanchin hung ziek vawng rawh; tuta hnung chu sum enkawltu hin ṭhang thei ta naw ti ni,’ a ta.

en: And the steward said within himself, What shall I do, seeing that my lord taketh away the stewardship from me? I have not strength to dig; to beg I am ashamed.
hmr: “Chun, sum enkawltu chun, a lungrilin, ‘Ka puin ka sum enkawl a mi bân ding hi iengtin am thâw tâng ka ti aw? hnuoi cho ka pei si nawh a, kut daw hlak chu kân zak sih a.

en: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.
hmr: Sum enkawl a mi bân phaa mîn an ina an mîn umtirna dingin ka thaw dân ding ka hriet tah,’ a ta.

en: And calling to him each one of his lord’s debtors, he said to the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
hmr: Chuongchun, a pu sum battuhai chu a ko seng a, a hmasatak kuoma chun, ‘Ka pu kuomah iengzât am i bat a?’ a ta.

en: And he said, A hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bond, and sit down quickly and write fifty.
hmr: Ama chun, ‘Hriek tekhâwng za khat,’ a ta. Chun, ama chun a kuomah, ‘I lekha la la, ṭhung vat la, sâwmnga ziek rawh,’ a ta.

en: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, A hundred measures of wheat. He saith unto him, Take thy bond, and write fourscore.
hmr: Chun, mi dang kuomah, ‘Nang iengzât am i bat a?’ a ta. Ama chun, ‘Bu tekhâwng za khat,’ a ta. Chun, ama chun a kuomah, ‘I lekha la la, sâwmriet ziek rawh,’ a ta.

en: And his lord commended the unrighteous steward because he had done wisely: for the sons of this world are for their own generation wiser than the sons of the light.
hmr: Chun, a pu chun, sum enkawltu fel naw chu a rem hriet leiin ân pâk tah a; var nauhai nêkin khawvêl nauhai hi an tulai dâna hin an var lem a nih.

en: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends by means of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when it shall fail, they may receive you into the eternal tabernacles.
hmr: “Ka hril cheu hi, sum tehlêmin in ta dingin ruolhai siem ro; sum a bohmang pha leh chatuona umnaa chun inumtira in umna dingin.

en: He that is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much: and he that is unrighteous in a very little is unrighteous also in much.
hmr: Tukhawm tlâwmte chunga ringum chu tamtak chunga khawm ring a um hlak. Tukhawm, tlâwmte chunga ringum naw chu tamtak chunga khawm ring a um nawh.

en: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
hmr: Sum tehlêm chunga hman ring in um naw chun, tûin am sum tak chu inkawltir a ti cheu a?

en: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?
hmr: Mi dang ta chunga hman ring in lo um ta naw chun, nangni ta ding chu tûin am pêng an ti cheu a?

en: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
hmr: Siehlaw tukhawmin hotu pahni rawng a bâwl kawp thei nawh; pakhat chu theidain pakhat chu dit a tih, annawleh, pakhat ṭanin pakhat hmusit a tih. Pathien le sum rawng in bâwl kawp thei nawh,” a ta.

en: And the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things; and they scoffed at him.
hmr: Chun, Pharisai tangka ngaina- tuhai chun chuong thu chu an hriet a, an nuisan a.

en: And he said unto them, Ye are they that justify yourselves in the sight of men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chun an kuomah, “Mi mithmua insukfel el in nih, nisienlakhawm, Pathienin in lungril a hriet sih a; mihriem laia an ichawimawi chu Pathien mithmua chun tirdakumtak a nih.

en: The law and the prophets were until John: from that time the gospel of the kingdom of God is preached, and every man entereth violently into it.
hmr: Dân le zâwlneihai thu chu Johan hung um chen khan a um a; chu chena inthawk chun Pathien ram Chanchin Ṭha hi an hril a, mi tin an lût hrâm seng a,

en: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tittle of the law to fall.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, Dân thu sun- hâng chîterek khawm a bo nêk chun vân le khawvêl bohmang a awl lem a nih.

en: Every one that putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and he that marrieth one that is put away from a husband committeth adultery.
hmr: “Tûkhawm nuhmei maa, nuhmei dang nei taphawt chu a uire a nih; tûkhawm mi nuhmei mâk nei taphawt chu a uire a nih.

en: Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, faring sumptuously every day:
hmr: “Chun, mi hausa tû amanih a um a, puon senduk le puon zai inhmitak a sil a, ni tin inhawitirtakin a um hlak a.

en: and a certain beggar named Lazarus was laid at his gate, full of sores,
hmr: Chun, a hming Lazar, kutdaw pakhat pânna ibâwm sip, a kawtkhâr bulah an inzâltir hlak a,

en: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table; yea, even the dogs came and licked his sores.
hmr: mi hausa dawkâna a fâk nawi tla chu fâk a nuom a; uihai hlak chun a pânna chu an liekpêk hlak a.

en: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and that he was carried away by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: and the rich man also died, and was buried.
hmr: Chun, hieng ang hi a na, kutdaw chu a thi a, vântirkohaiin an fepui a, Abraham ângsûngah an sieh a. Mi hausa khawm chu a thi a, phûmin a um tah a.

en: And in Hades he lifted up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
hmr: Chun, mithi khuoa chun natak tuorin a um a, a hang dâk a, hlataka Abraham, a ângsûnga Lazar um leh a hmu tah a.

en: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am in anguish in this flame.
hmr: Chun, a khêk a, ‘Pa Abraham, mi lunginsiet la, Lazar kha hung tir rawh, a kutpâr tuiah inchie sien- la; ka lei sukdeina dingin; hi meichawka hin ka na bêk bêk el,’ a ta.

en: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and Lazarus in like manner evil things: but now here he is comforted, and thou art in anguish.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, Abrahamin, ‘Ka naupa, i dam lai khan thil ṭha i hmuh a, chuong ang bawkin Lazarin thil ṭha naw a hmu kha hre zing ta la; nisienlakhawm, ama chu tuhin hitaka hin thlamuongtakin a um a, nang chu i na a ni kha.

en: And besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that they that would pass from hence to you may not be able, and that none may cross over from thence to us.
hmr: Hieng naw khawm hi, hitaka inthawka nangni kuoma fe tumhai chu an fe thei nawna dingin le, tu- khawm khataka inthawka keini kuom tieng an hung kai thei nawna dingin, keini le nangni inkâra hin hnuoi kak nasatak an siem tlat a nih,’ a ta.

en: And he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house;
hmr: “Chun, ama chun, ‘Anleh, pa, ama chu ka pa ina bêk infetir dingin ka ngên che;

en: for I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.
hmr: piengpui pasal panga ka nei sih a; hi na umnaa hin hung ve rawi an tih, ṭhahnemngaitakin hril raw se,’ a ta.

en: But Abraham saith, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.
hmr: Abraham ruok chun, ‘Mosie le zâwlneihai an nei annâwm; chuhai thu chu ngai raw hai se,’ a ta.

en: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one go to them from the dead, they will repent.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, ‘Pa Abraham, ni lo e, mithi laia mi meu an kuomah fe sienla, sim an tih,’ a ta.

en: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, if one rise from the dead.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, ‘Mosie le zâwlneihai thu an awi naw chun, mithi laia mi tho nâwk sienla khawm awi chuong naw ni hai,’ a tih a,” a ta.
